result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Tallier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To be paid within first 6 months of probation
To be paid within first 6 months of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
The defendant must take all medications prescribed to him and only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: State's Settlement Recommendation
Does not plan to seek.

Defendant David J Tallier in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:23 AM. State - resolved - dismisssing the repeater enhancer from the count - plead G - joint recommendation to withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges, did not discuss any other conditions but standard conditions would apply of AODA, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any taverns or bars, employment. Voorhees and Tallier agree. Court amends the count to dismiss the repeater component. Tallier pleads G to amended count. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Tallier makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges within first 6 months of probation, 100 hours of community service within the first year of probation, take all medications prescribed to him and only in the manner in which they are prescribed, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expungement rights given, credit can be addressed at a later time, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
State's Settlment Recommendation
Final pre-trial on July 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David J Tallier in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:58 PM. State will be dismissing the repeater enhancer, defendant to plead G to remaining charge as alleged without the repeater allegation, defense requesting PSI and State is not objecting to it, free to argue sentence. Voorhees and Tallier agree. Voorhees provides Court with state's settlement recommendations with hand written modication and plea questionnaire, would like to make points for consideration of a PSI. Court makes statement in regards to its opinion of a PSI. Voorhees is ready to proceed with the plea today and will make points in regards to request for PSI. Court denies the request for a PSI for stated reasons. Voorhees confers with client as to how he wishes to proceed. Tallier makes statement in regards to proceeding today or taking matter to JT. State - plea offer was sent on 6/20/16. Court will set this matter for another FPT, continues bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
State
Defendant's
Final pre-trial on June 29, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David J Tallier in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:34 AM. Voorhees states he was just appointed to the case and would like to go ahead with a PH but is willing to get a continuance for it if the Court will allow. Recess at 10:35 AM. Recalled at 10:52 AM. State calls Chief Dan Packard. Packard sworn in at 10:52 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Voorhees at 10:55 AM. State objects - irrelevant - overruled (10:57 AM). Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Voorhees has Information, waives reading of it, will enter NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.
JV
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David J Tallier in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:39 PM. Scholke was originally on the case, was informed that the defendant hired Jeff Joy, Joy explains confusion. Tallier makes statement, stated only had one letter of correspondence from Attorney Joy and that was in regards to the motion to withdraw as counsel. Joy responds, no porivisions made for any retainer. Court grants motion for withdrawal and Joy is excused from the case. Scholke is not required to stay on the either. Tallier instructed to contact SPD again for another attorney, also given court appointed paperwork in Court. Court continues bond and sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
JV
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record
Motion hearing on May 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Regarding Motion to Withdraw as Attorney of Record
